title: Venice floods as weather catches city off-guard
description: Flood barriers were rolled out too late, causing heavy rain to flood the city.

title: Finder of Forrest Fenn’s treasure reveals identity
description: This year, Forrest Fenn confirmed the discovery of the bronze chest he hid in the Rocky Mountains.

title: Covid-19: The day of the UK's 'tremendous shot in the arm'
description: From the first jab to that quote from the PM, the NHS's biggest ever vaccination programme is underway.

title: Somersault goal: Nader Mohammadi scores somersault throw in for Paykan in Persian League
description: Nader Mohammadi scores with a somersault throw for Paykan in the Persian Pro League after the ball takes a touch off Gol Gohar Sirjan goalkeeper Alireza Haghighi.

title: RAF plane flies low over world's biggest iceberg
description: The RAF releases footage from its reconnaissance flight over the giant Antarctic berg known as A68a.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: 'Hopefully next year we'll be living a normal life'
description: Patients and health workers are excited to be among the first to get the Covid vaccine.

title: Unions squabble over Santa membership claims
description: Debate rages over whether he's a postie, an actor, a bureaucrat, a musician or an honorary firefighter.

title: 'Right now, hit songwriters are driving Ubers'
description: A parliamentary inquiry into music streaming is told that songwriters can't pay their rent.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: First person receives Pfizer jab in UK
description: Margaret Keenan, who turns 91 next week, becomes the first person in the world to get the jab as part of a mass vaccination programme, calling it the "best early birthday present".

title: Steve Diamond: Sale Sharks director of rugby leaves for personal reasons
description: Sale director of rugby Steve Diamond leaves the Premiership club for personal reasons after 10 years in charge.

title: Covid: Royal visit during pandemic questioned by minister
description: As the royal tour arrives in Wales, a minister says he would "rather no one was having unnecessary visits".

title: Rob Burrow: Kevin Sinfield marathon fundraiser passes £2m for Motor Neurone Disease research
description: Money raised by Leeds Rhinos legend Kevin Sinfield for team-mate Rob Burrow and the Motor Neurone Disease Association passes £2m.

title: Brexit: PM says 'sweet reason' can get UK and EU to trade deal
description: Boris Johnson says "hope springs eternal" ahead of a meeting with the European Commission president.

title: Covid: Christmas comes early as grocery sales 'hit record' in November
description: Spending surged last month as eating out was restricted by England's national lockdown, figures suggest.

title: Isle of Wight beach monolith mystery solved
description: Tom Dunford says he put the pillar up for "fun" and plans to remove it in a few days.

title: South Africa v England: Tourists' 'unconfirmed' coronavirus cases declared false
description: Two members of England's touring party who gave "unconfirmed positive" coronavirus tests will return to the UK after testing and analysis shows they are not infected.

title: Kay Burley: Sky News presenter apologises for Covid breach
description: The TV journalist has said sorry for an "error of judgement" while celebrating her 60th birthday.

title: Mt Everest grows by nearly a metre to new height
description: For the first time, China and Nepal agree an official height for the world's highest peak.

title: Earth Photo winners announced
description: A project on abandoned spaces reclaimed by nature has won the 2020 Earth Photo competition.

title: 'Mix-and-match' coronavirus vaccines to be tested
description: Trials are being planned in the UK to see if combining Covid vaccines might give the best protection.

title: Have Scotland's level four restrictions worked?
description: As people in Scotland wait to hear what Covid alert level their area will be put in to, we analyse the statistics and ask whether the toughest measures have been working.

title: Under-18s banned from lottery scratchcards in crackdown
description: The ban from next October is part of "a major review" of laws to protect children and vulnerable people.

title: Who gets the Pfizer vaccine first and when can I have it?
description: A vaccine for Covid-19 has been given emergency approval and is now rolling out.

title: Christchurch massacre: Inquiry finds failures ahead of attack
description: But the report reveals there were a series of failures ahead of the 2019 attack in New Zealand.

title: Barker chasing rainbow jerseys at inaugural Esports Worlds
description: Olympic champion Elinor Barker aims for a world title at the inaugural Cycling Esports World Championships.

title: ‘I love to do things differently’ – Leclerc on path to greatness at Ferrari
description: In an exclusive interview with BBC Sport, Charles Leclerc says it would be "incredible" to become a Ferrari legend.

title: Madeleine McCann: Public 'would reach same conclusion' on suspect
description: Prosecutor says if public "knew the evidence we had" they would think Madeleine McCann was killed.

title: Advent calendar: Day 8 - Katarina Johnson-Thompson competes in a home heptathlon against her dogs
description: Day eight of BBC Sport's 2020 advent calendar sees world champion Katarina Johnson-Thompson competing against her dogs, Bronx and Chorizo, in a home heptathlon.

title: Cold water swim 'obliterated' woman's short-term memory
description: Sue Hodge lost seven hours and has no memory of going in the sea or even driving to Newquay.

title: Yorkshire Dales and North York Moors made Dark Sky Reserves
description: Planets, shooting stars and the Northern Lights can be seen at night in winter due to good astronomy conditions.

title: Grief: Archbishop Welby and Chief Rabbi Mirvis reflect
description: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby, and Chief Rabbi Ephraim Mirvis reflect on their grief.

title: So you want a career in computer games tournaments?
description: The first e-sports graduates are about to hit the jobs market, so was it worth the time and expense?

title: 'Looking for part-time jobs is soul-destroying'
description: Four out of five job vacancies make no mention of flexible working options, research suggests.

title: Coronavirus in Kenya: The doctor who helped children to smile
description: Dr Ashraf Emarah is one of 14 doctors to have died from coronavirus in Kenya, prompting a strike call.

title: John Lennon: I was there the day he died
description: The BBC's Tom Brook is still haunted by being the first British reporter when Lennon was shot.

title: Coronavirus: Sputnik V vaccine rushed out to wary Russians
description: Medics, teachers and social workers get priority for Russia’s Sputnik V vaccine.

title: Mateusz Kuzimski: The veg packer who became a pro footballer
description: Mateusz Kuzimski was working on a line in England - before returning to Poland to chase his dream.

title: Kabul University attack: Fears for mental health one month on
description: One month after the Kabul University attack, students worry about the impact it's had on their mental health.

title: Coronavirus: Your vaccine questions answered by an expert
description: Dr Penny Ward, a professor of pharmaceutical medicine, answers four questions about the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Astronomy: 'Odd radio circles' in the sky a ‘genuine mystery’
description: A new high-powered telescope has discovered inexplicable ghostly circles in the sky.

title: 'Brother against brother' in Trump country
description: What's it like to be a Biden voter in a Trump heartland where many believe the election was rigged?
